intro: Anaphalis muliensis, commonly known as the cloud flower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its soft, woolly leaves and fluffy, white capitula that resemble clouds. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine meadows at high elevations. It is a perennial herb that produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a composite head. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
